data.title: PATH not being inherited correctly in Yosemite
data.body:
Hi,

I have the newest version of atom installed (1.0.2), on OSX Yosemite. I have the shell scripts installed, but when starting atom from command line (iTerm2), the PATH variable is inherited wrongly. This is screwing up atom-script when trying to run my python scripts (I'm using Anaconda python distribution which is not being picked up inside Atom) and also means it can't find pep8 and all that stuff. 

So when I use `echo $PATH` in iTerm2, I get 

```
opt/local/bin:/opt/local/sbin:/usr/local/Cellar/ruby/1.9.3-p194/bin:/Users/Steven/anaconda/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/opt/X11/bin:/usr/local/git/bin:/Library/TeX/texbin
```

However, when inside atom, using the terminal package, I call the same thing `echo $PATH` and get the following (sorry couldn't copy and paste?!):

![atom_screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1272030/8923322/c3a3ea5c-3521-11e5-84a8-d4df3f1ec5f9.png)

This matches the value of `process.env.PATH` as shown in the console. 

Where did it even get the `mrmpi-11Mar13` value from?

My `.bash_profile` exports look like this:

```
export PATH="/usr/local/bin:$PATH"

# added by Anaconda 2.2.0 installer
export PATH="/Users/Steven/anaconda/bin:$PATH"

#Change to homebrew ruby
export PATH="/usr/local/Cellar/ruby/1.9.3-p194/bin:$PATH"

# MacPorts Installer addition on 2012-06-05_at_12:55:53: adding an appropriate PATH variable for use with MacPorts.
export PATH="/opt/local/bin:/opt/local/sbin:$PATH"
```

I've tried uninstalling and re-installing atom to no avail.

data.title: Update language-javascript to 0.85.0
data.body:
Fixes an issue where strings would be incorrectly highlighted in the following scenario:

``` js
write("){");
```

(Also, sorry for the many JS PRs lately - maybe I should try bumping the version less often :P)

data.title: Visual change to indicate when editor loses focus
data.body:
I think there needs to be some visual clue when the editor pane has lost focus (eg. to the tree-view), particularly when some editor text is currently selected. Ordinarily if the editor loses focus the cursor disappears to give some indication, but when text is highlighted the cursor has already gone. If you now switch the focus to the tree-view there is no change in the editor appearance.

Highlighting then clicking on the tree-view taking focus away from the editor:
![editor_selected_text_focus](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11758299/8920195/1c0eb884-34be-11e5-829f-5dea77d2bc05.gif)

I had a couple of issues when highlighting with the intention of deleting text, then clicking on the tree-view (expand a sub-folder or something minor without changing the active file), then having been distracted, coming back to press backspace to delete the text and nearly lost a file. :( (thankful for the confirm deletion dialog! :+1:)

data.title: Fix Arch build instructions again
data.body:
npm is missing from the current instructions. Also, I added a note about the AUR as an alternative for building from source on Arch.  

This addresses issues raised by @Narrat in #7426 and @fusion809 in #7511.

data.title: ENFILE: file table overflow
data.body: I'm not sure whether Atom is actually the root cause of this or not. I'm running the canary build of Chrome, and it's crashing periodically too. But Atom is certainly having a problem. **Atom Version**: 1.0.2 **System**: Mac OS X 10.10.3 **Thrown From**: [language-html](https://github.com/atom/language-html) package, v0.40.0 ### Stack Trace Failed to load a language-html package grammar ``` At ENFILE: file table overflow, open '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar' in /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/language-html/grammars/html.json Error: ENFILE: file table overflow, open '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar' at Error (native) at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/language-html/grammars/html.json:1:1 ``` ### Commands ``` ``` ### Config ``` json { "core": { "projectHome": "/Users/will/code", "audioBeep": false, "disabledPackages": [ "autocomplete-snippets", "vim-mode", "script", "spark-monitor-atom", "typewriter" ] } } ``` ### Installed Packages ``` coffee # User jupyter-notebook-atom, v0.0.0 language-elm, v0.5.0 language-julia, v0.9.0 language-latex, v0.6.1 language-lua, v0.9.4 language-r, v0.2.0 react, v0.12.4 # Dev No dev packages ```

data.title: Memory leak (v1.02) on Win7
data.body:
Just installed Atom v.1.02.. I like what I see so far except....
I am experiencing a memory leak on win7
My colleague has the same experience.

You can reproduce it at will:
Start ProcessExplorer.
Start Atom - it should be ok until you load the first file for edit.
With one file open PE will show that Atom is consuming 4k blocks every couple of seconds.
With more than one file open the consumption goes up accordlngly.

data.title: Render tiles upper in the stack in front of the ones below
data.body:
Fixes #8026.

![screen shot 2015-07-27 at 20 34 41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/8914361/1ce2edd0-349f-11e5-8954-de2c6c1ef65a.png)

As a temporary stopgap measure until we explore better alternatives, we have decided to tackle the above issue by putting tiles upper in the stack in front of the ones below.

We need to put tiles into a separate div with its own stacking context, so that tiles do not overlap other elements such as the cursors or the wrap-guide.

/cc: @nathansobo @abe33 @rbu

data.title: Fullscreen refocuses to most recent atom window (El Capitan)
data.body:
When switch to a fullscreen instance of Atom in El Capitan via either a three-finger-swipe or keyboard shortcut, Atom will switch focus to the most recently focussed window rather than the one in the current space.

I have two fullscreen instances of Atom, A and B. I edit a file in Atom A, then switch my space to B which is one space to the right. Before I can edit or interact in any way, mission control is forced back to Atom A.

Hopefully that's clear enough. I'm pretty sure this is unique to El Capitan.

data.title: Weird Commenting out lines issue
data.body: Hi there!  Found an odd bug which may be getting brought on by a package, but am not entirely sure.  When I comment out a line in any langue on any file, the line below also gets commented out.  Or at the very least grey'd out.  Thank you in advance for your help!

data.title: Destroy folds when DisplayBuffer is destroyed
data.body: Fixes #4562

data.title: Specify class attributes directly for overlay nodes
data.body:
Specifying a `.class` parameter when creating an overlay decoration now applies that CSS class to the created `atom-overlay` element:

``` coffee
decoration = editor.decorateMarker(marker, {type: 'overlay', item: element, class: 'my-overlay'})
```

Usually, this isn't necessary, because you can apply styles to the item's view instead. I hit a problem with that when I tried to apply positioning styles to the item, though, because the overlay element's absolute positioning interfered with the positioning I was trying to apply. I've had [a workaround](https://github.com/smashwilson/merge-conflicts/blob/1088c7fbcf32924998ff6c88c41f088bf0da37c9/lib/view/covering-view.coffee#L23) in place for a while, but being able to apply styles to the overlay element itself would make it a bit more graceful, I think. It would also make overlay parameters a bit more consistent with those accepted by the other decorations.

data.title: Add update mechanism for :penguin:
data.body: Temporary(?) solution to #2956 while better solution is discussed.

data.title: :memo: Add missing argument
Big file saving is too long
data.body:
When I am trying to save big files (5000+lines), atom do it too long, about 10 seconds. As an example, sublime save file very fast - less than 1 second.

My system spec:
1) CPU - AMD A4-5000 APU with Radeon(TM) HD Graphics × 4 
2) ssd 64gb
3) OS - ubuntu 15.04 x64
4) uname -r: 3.19.0-16-generic
5) Atom version - 1.0.2

data.title: Usability: Add button beside settings to highlight config.cson
data.body:
The Settings dialog at the moment has some user interface to edit the config.cson file. Clicking or changing any value will result in the change of the config.cson file. To explain the use of the config.cson and to understand the relationship easier I propose to add a link next to the config that highlights the property in the config.cson that would be modified on click.

![atomconfig](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/914122/8894616/158dbb5c-33f8-11e5-9594-958ca02bf0c7.gif)

data.title: Make disabling DirectWrite an option
data.body: There should be an option to disable DirectWrite.

data.title: Python
data.body:
``` python
import random
import time

anwser = 0
x = 0

while x < 10 :

    num = random.randint(1,9)
    print(num)
    anwser += num
    time.sleep(1)
    x += 1

print("")
print(anwser)
```

instead of printing line by line it waits for the whole program to execute then shows you everything. it should show you line by line

data.title: Uncommenting block comments not behaving as expected
data.body:
If a block of code is commented out, and I place my cursor within the block and press `CMD + /`, I think the desired behavior here is to uncomment it. This is how it works in Sublime and I think it's very intuitive.

This is what happens in Atom:

![block_uncomment_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9244728/8892463/63db13cc-330d-11e5-99c5-c8d4f82e2b30.gif)

I can't imagine a situation where this is ever what I needed to do. I think it would be great if the 'toggle comment' command actually uncomments code if your cursor is placed within a commented block.

data.title: "Search in Directory" is unreliable and not searching all files :(
data.body: Atom 1.0.2 This seems to happen on larger directories, and I've run into it a few times now but don't have a consistent reproduction case -- Search in files often turns up empty or partial results. The only thing I did between taking the following screenshots was: - open a few files in the directory - re-do search

data.title: right-click menus are inconsistent
data.body: Atom 1.0.2 It _seems_ to be a difference between the root folder and sub-folders

data.title: Atom treats left click as right click (maybe?) on opensuse Tumbleweed
data.body:
![atom tumbleweed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1209314/8892256/22362abe-3304-11e5-8053-afd1291e3e0f.png)

Right clicking on the title of the file doesn't open the context menu like it should. Right clicking on the page doesn't do anything. There's this big blue dot that follows me everywhere I left click (with the weird tablet? context menu)

data.title: Should open the last window with opened items when open the first window
data.body:
When I quit the application, Atom re-open the last project that I was working on it.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1437734/8891972/ab7bdcf8-330c-11e5-93bc-0dc4c92be0e0.png)

However, when I close the last window, and open the first window, it does not open the last open items 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1437734/8891978/e68d6208-330c-11e5-8c60-221f0279a882.png)

It works the same as I click left-top x button assuming it share the same logic.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1437734/8891995/8da73f0a-330d-11e5-89ef-eea21ffdf0de.png)

IMO, it should reopen the last window with files opened like it does on quitting the application, when there is no window active.

data.title: Update language-javascript to 0.84.0
data.body:
0.83.0 fixes an issue with regex highlighting after a `const` declaration.
0.84.0 fixes the `setInterval` and `setTimeout` snippets not being properly escaped.

data.title: RTL and LTR mixture in a line makes some problems.
data.body:
There's a bug (more like a problem) with mixing rtl and ltr languages in a line in Atom. The cursor would go crazy and it would be almost impossible to get what you see. Take a look. the third line is the clipboard of the selection in line 1.
https://imgur.com/q1DAEJt

data.title: [feature request] Display non-breaking space character when showing invisibles.
data.body:
It would be really nice if the editor displayed an "invisibles" symbol for the character UNICODE NON BREAK SPACE `U+00A0` as it most often is added by mistake and gives pretty perplexing error messages. It is currently visually indistinguishable from the normal space. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/765647/8891079/ba5cf786-3319-11e5-9786-75be7a4b618f.png)

(You can't see it but it's there...)

data.title: Can't open files from application's menus
data.body:
[Video Recording](http://gfycat.com/MixedFineFinwhale)
## Repro Steps
1. Start Atom in safe mode (cli: `atom --safe`)
2. Attempt opening a file or folder by file->open or by `application: open file` from the cmd-shift-P menu

**Expected:** File Opens.
**Actual:** Open dialog gets stuck on screen, file does not open.
## Versions
- **Atom:**       1.0.2
- **Atom-Shell:** 0.22.3
- **OS:**         Mac OS X 10.11 (Note: This is public beta 2)
- **Misc**
  - Could not determine apm version information
## Other info

This also happens when trying to do "add folder to project". It's as if all file handling functionality is almost completely broken. Only way to get files into the editor right now is to go to the CLI and do `atom filename` - which works, but is annoying :)

---

<small>This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` v0.7.1.</small>

data.title: [bug?] Soft Wrap not works right with Chinese characters
data.body:
I narrowed the editor window to 10 English characters width, and enable "Soft Wrap".

Type 'abcedfghijklmn', it works well, the 'k' is wrapped to second line.

Type '一二三四五六七八九十', it now works right, nothing is wrapped and only the first five characters are displayed.

Type '一二三四五六七八九十一', then the eleventh character '一' is wrapped to second line.

data.title: Atom crashes on minified js files
data.body:
It's quite annoying every time I try to open a big minified Javascript or css file, Atom freeze and sometimes I manage to close the document, some other I need to reload the software.
Thus I'm not sure if this bug is happening just on my machine, I would appreciate a feedback on this topic

data.title: Old tabs startup
data.body:
When I start Atom it doesn't remember my most recent open windows but instead shows me 3 tabs from a now very old session.
This also happens when running `atom --dev`

Mac 10.10.4 Atom 1.0.2
